issue.title: [Java] Add JSON read/write support for decimals for integration tests
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1238](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1238). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1238?focusedCommentId=16094020) by Bryan Cutler (bryanc):*
I can get started on this to be ready for integration tests

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1238?focusedCommentId=16138432) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This is getting pretty close to being needed. `[~icexelloss]` may be able to look at this if `[~bryanc]` is not able

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1238?focusedCommentId=16138928) by Li Jin (icexelloss):*
I can take a look if `[~bryanc]` is not available. What's the json format for decimals?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1238?focusedCommentId=16138971) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I think we should encode as hexadecimal like with binary types. The metadata probably needs the precision, scale, and bit width

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1238?focusedCommentId=16139093) by Bryan Cutler (bryanc):*
It would be really great to get integration tests for decimal in for the next release.  I should be able to get this done in the next couple of days, if not then I'll ping you `[~icexelloss]`.
